publications: [{"title":"Accessibility and Inclusivity at National Law School","subtitle":"Economic and Political Weekly","date":"January 6, 2018"},{"title":"International Aid: A Critical Assessment of Official Development Assessment","subtitle":"IUP Journal of International Relations","date":"2015"},{"title":"The Dwelling House: A Possible Reconcepualisation","subtitle":"NALSAR Student Law Review","date":"2015"},{"title":"The Elusive Island of Excellence - A Study on Student Demographics, Accessibility and Inclusivity at National Law School 2015-16","description":"Report studying in detail the demographic patterns in the undergraduate batches that joined NLSIU between 2011-2016, with emphasis on the effect of socio-economic background of students in their performance within NLSIU. Collected and analysed data from 97% of the student body. The report was published as an official publication of NLSIU, released by the Vice Chancellor in the presence of Hon. President Pranab Mukherjee at NLSIU's 24th Annual Convocation Ceremony."}]
